content.title: Self-Expanding Stents
content.description: Vascular stents that expand to vessel diameter upon deployment, made from nitinol (nickel-titanium alloy) with shape memory properties.
content.mechanism: Nitinol's shape memory allows stent to be constrained during delivery and expand to predetermined diameter at body temperature.

characteristics.radial_force: Chronic outward force resists external compression

indications: Vessels subject to external compression (SFA, popliteal)
content.deployment_technique: Positioned under fluoroscopy, unsheathed to allow controlled expansion
limitations: Cannot be post-dilated to larger diameter
May not fully expand in calcified lesions
Precise positioning more difficult than balloon-expandable
